content: >http://network.nationalpost.com/np/blogs/fullcomment/archive/2009/05/19/peter-goodspeed-darth-vader-s-afghanistan.aspx A Shao-lin monk-grasshopper approach to the Taliban war is a significant change of tactical thinking compared to the past 7 years of the 'high-explosive east LA' approach. Will the digital warrior prove to be as tough as the goat-herds of Khost and Helmand?
reply: >http://network.nationalpost.com/np/blogs/fullcomment/archive/2009/05/19/peter-goodspeed-darth-vader-s-afghanistan.aspx A Shao-lin monk-grasshopper approach to the Taliban war is a significant change of tactical thinking compared to the past 7 years of the 'high-explosive east LA' approach. Will the digital warrior prove to be as tough as the goat-herds of Khost and Helmand?
title: 'Darth Vader' to Afghanistan

content: - What's Shao-lin monk-grasshopper about this dude? He's a snake-eatin' assassin. All good and fine when you want to take out selected bad guys, but not exactly a comprehensive COIN strategy or anything. -
reply: - What's Shao-lin monk-grasshopper about this dude? He's a snake-eatin' assassin. All good and fine when you want to take out selected bad guys, but not exactly a comprehensive COIN strategy or anything. -
title: 'Darth Vader' to Afghanistan

content: Lieutenant General Stanley McChrystal, a 53-year-old West Point graduate who last week was appointed the new U.S. commander in Afghanistan, made his career in the U.S. Special Forces. His specialty is special forces. But as a West Point grad he should be qualified to lead conventional units as well. Let's see what the man can accomplish.
reply: Lieutenant General Stanley McChrystal, a 53-year-old West Point graduate who last week was appointed the new U.S. commander in Afghanistan, made his career in the U.S. Special Forces. title: 'Darth Vader' to Afghanistan
